edu.gmu.cs.amped.client
Class Transaction

java.lang.Object
  edu.gmu.cs.amped.client.Transaction

public class Transaction
extends java.lang.Object

Encapsulates a single message and ID bundle corresponding to some occurrence requiring approval. A transaction may be signed or without a signature. It can be in any state specified in the enum Status. Transaction text and identifiers are immutable; in order to modify either a new Transaction object must be created.

Author:
luke@faraone.cc (Luke Faraone)

Constructor Detail

Transaction

public Transaction(int id,
                   java.lang.String text,
                   Status status)
Creates a new Transaction object with the specified transaction ID and transaction text.

Parameters:
id - A positive integer specifying the primary key of the transaction in the transaction database. This is usually specified by the server.
text - The text of the transaction as it should be displayed to the user.

Transaction

public Transaction(java.lang.String jsonBlob)
Creates a new Transaction object using data extracted from the specified JSON

Parameters:
jsonBlob - JSON in the format specified by the specification.
Method Detail

getId

public int getId()
Returns:
the transaction ID, which should be the primary key of the transaction on the server.

getSignature

public java.lang.String getSignature()
Returns:
a String comprising a Keyczar-signed copy of the transaction. Note that this method does not do any verification; it is up to you to ensure the signature is accurate.

getStatus

public Status getStatus()

getText

public java.lang.String getText()
Returns:
the transaction text

setSignature

Parameters:
sig - Stored as the new signature for this transaction.
